    teams(String teams)
    Assign players to teams.
    By default the PGN tags WhiteTeam and BlackTeam are used.
    One line per player, formatted as such:
    <Team name>;<FIDE ID or Player name>
      var broadcast = client.broadcasts().create(params -> params
     .name("Broadcast Name")
     .description("Broadcast Description")
     .teamTable()
     .teams("""
         Team Cats;3408230
         Team Dogs;Scooby Doo
         """));

  • Method Details

    • name

      BroadcastsApiAuth.BroadcastBuilder name(String name)
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the broadcast tournament.
      Length must be between 3 and 80 characters.
      Example: Sinquefield Cup

    • description

      BroadcastsApiAuth.BroadcastBuilder description(String description)
      Parameters:
      description - Optional long description of the broadcast. Markdown is supported.
      Length must be less than 20,000 characters.

    • players

      BroadcastsApiAuth.BroadcastBuilder players(String players)

      Replace player names, ratings and titles.

      When broadcast rounds receive PGN data (pushed or polled), it is possible to apply player information replacement of the tags in the PGN, based on the player name tags.
      The replacements are specified in the broadcast with one line per player.
      It is possible to augment the PGN tags with information from their FIDE profile by matching a player name to a FIDE ID, or by manually specifying values of PGN tags.

      Format
      <player name> / <FIDE ID> / <title> / <rating> / <new name>

      The fields are optional and can be left blank.
      Player names ignore case and punctuation, and match all possible combinations of 2 words:
      "Jorge Rick Vito" will match "Jorge Rick", "jorge vito", "Rick, Vito", etc.

      Example:

        var broadcast = client.broadcasts().create(params -> params
     .name("Broadcast Name")
     .description("Broadcast Description")
     .players("""
         Anna / 14111330
         Art / 7818424 / NM
         Some One / / WGM / 2700 / Numero Uno
         Someone Else / / / / Deuce
         Other Player / / / 1300
         """));

    • teams

      BroadcastsApiAuth.BroadcastBuilder teams(String teams)
      Assign players to teams.
      By default the PGN tags WhiteTeam and BlackTeam are used.
      One line per player, formatted as such:
      <Team name>;<FIDE ID or Player name>
        var broadcast = client.broadcasts().create(params -> params
     .name("Broadcast Name")
     .description("Broadcast Description")
     .teamTable()
     .teams("""
         Team Cats;3408230
         Team Dogs;Scooby Doo
         """));

    • visibility

      BroadcastsApiAuth.BroadcastBuilder visibility(BroadcastsApiAuth.Visibility visibility)

      Who can view the broadcast.

      public: Default. Anyone can view the broadcast unlisted: Only people with the link can view the broadcast private: Only the broadcast owner(s) can view the broadcast

    • visibility

      default BroadcastsApiAuth.BroadcastBuilder visibility(Function<BroadcastsApiAuth.Visibility.Provider, BroadcastsApiAuth.Visibility> provider)

      Who can view the broadcast.

      public: Default. Anyone can view the broadcast unlisted: Only people with the link can view the broadcast private: Only the broadcast owner(s) can view the broadcast

    • tiebreaks

      BroadcastsApiAuth.BroadcastBuilder tiebreaks(String... names)

      Tiebreak short codes

      Up to 5 entries

      AOB APPO APRO ARO ARO-C1 ARO-C2 ARO-M1 ARO-M2
      BH BH-C1 BH-C2 BH-M1 BH-M2 BPG BWG
      DE FB FB-C1 FB-C2 FB-M1 FB-M2 KS
      PS PS-C1 PS-C2 PS-M1 PS-M2 PTP
      SB SB-C1 SB-C2 SB-M1 SB-M2 TPR WON

    • tiebreaks

      default BroadcastsApiAuth.BroadcastBuilder tiebreaks(Consumer<BroadcastsApiAuth.TiebreakParameters> parameters)
